amendment.description: Amendment sought to allow States that are administering their own Federally approved wetlands permit programs as of the date of enactment to continue administering their own programs rather than the new program established in the bill.
amendment.purpose: An amendment (printed as amendment No. 23 in the Congressional Record of May 9) to stipulate that states which have received approval for wetlands protection programs will not be required to reapply to continue administering them.

vote.text: On agreeing to the Frelinghuysen amendment (A035) Failed by recorded vote: 181 - 243 (Roll no. 334).
